text.tspan: 失去了 LLM 的训练优势：
1）首先要有丰富的训练资料
2）updates 要非常多而频繁
3）如果可能的话，利用 trained models
首先也观测到，
LLM 的结构非常有利于 encoding thought processes
但我们现在就是企图把 LLM 放进 RL 迴路里
在这一点上没有不同，
不同的似乎是放弃了 predict next token 的训练方法？
那么训练方法有什么不同了呢？
Thought 在 WM 的出现往往不能直接得到奖励
这已经大大地令 updates 稀疏了很多
训练方式：
当新句子从 WM 里出现，我们需要 sequitur score
而这似乎很明显需要 现有的 LLM 评分
the state contains many sentences:
each sentence is sent to a "teacher" LLM for evaluation:
given the current state / context, is this sentence a good sequitur?
the result is what I call a
"sequitur score" which
serves as rewards for RL
This is an LLM turned
into the policy function
of RL -- the "actions" it
outputs are thoughts
RL loop
LLM
teacher
新的问题出现：
LLM 本来就可以输出 next token
那么所谓 RL update 是什么？
那是要透过 policy function 来理解
那么 policy update 和 plain update 有
什么不同呢？
On the left is the basic RL (reinforcement learning) architecture, by which the
state asymptotically approximates "the world" by maximizing rewards while
interacting with the world. On the right is the basic auto-encoder architecture
(which compresses world-data and tries to re-construct it), and is the basis of
current LLMs. Our goal is to combine these two:
Long story short, I came up with the following architecture which seems to be
the same as RLHF and DeepSeek's architectures, ie, it coincides with the
"mainstream" approach. This architecture has the advantage that its internal
state is expressed in natural language, so we can simply "read off" its
thoughts. Also, the reinforcement learning "loop" will force its thinking to
become logically coherent during the process of reward maximization; this
solves the problem of hallucinations.
So we have a sort of consensus architecture for AGI and the remaining task is
just to make the training process more efficient. This is more of an
engineering task but does not require further theoretical breakthroughs.
